cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 35 mi ENE of Daytona Beach Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing north‐northwest along the southeast U.S. coast, then turning north on Saturday and curving northeast just offshore of North Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: very near the central South Carolina coast (close to the Charleston–Hilton Head stretch)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of Surf City NC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Cocoa Beach FL to Surf City NC (includes entire SC coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northeast Florida, Georgia, South Carolina and southern North Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm winds arriving Friday evening, with a 57% chance of 50-kt (58-mph) winds and up to a 22% chance of hurricane-force (64-kt) winds at the port Saturday morning.
weather_observation.storm_surge: NHC storm-surge forecast 4–6 ft above ground from Edisto Beach SC to Cape Fear NC includes Charleston Harbor; life-threatening inundation possible at Saturday high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches of rain possible in the Charleston area, with locally higher totals up to 15 inches producing flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf/rip currents and the low risk of isolated tornadoes in coastal rainbands.
